description.narrative: The child and social protection systems are strengthened to provide consolidated interventions to ensure the right of every child to live in a caring and supportive family environment

mailing-address.narrative: 87 A. Doundukov Blvd. Fl.2 Sofia 1504 Bulgaria P.O. Box 801

sector.narrative: Alternative care reform and service provision
Justice, birth registration/CRVS, and alternative care - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Protective services for children on the move
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Social welfare workforce strengthening - Case management, referral, capacity development

title.narrative: Bulgaria Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change
UNICEF Programmes in Bulgaria (Adolescents and young people)
UNICEF Programmes in Bulgaria (Assistance in emergencies and humanitarian crises)
UNICEF Programmes in Bulgaria (Child and Youth Participation)
UNICEF Programmes in Bulgaria (Early Childhood Development)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Bulgaria: Evaluation of the UNICEF demonstration Home Visiting services for families with young children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The child and social protection systems are strengthened to provide consolidated interventions to ensure the right of every child to live in a caring and supportive family environment

description.narrative: Continuous and steady implementation and progress of child care reform, including deinstitutionalisation process; the new Social Services Act is adopted by the Parliament but its entering into force is delayed ; the Analysis of the child protection system in Bulgaria is finalized and a mapping of social services workforce is initiated; the outreach approach in providing tailored support to most vulnerable and excluded children and families is scaled up-nationally; 2,501 families and 3,735 children from vulnerable and isolated communities benefited from outreach and preventive services, supported by UNICEF CO. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/12/2019

title.narrative: Social welfare workforce strengthened and connected to social protection system (case management, referral capacity development)

baseline.value: 800 social workers in statutory child protection departments; Case management procedures existing, but not followed properly

target.value: 2022:At least 10% increase of number of social workers in child protection department. A system in place for continuous training and development of social workers

title.narrative: Social welfare workforce strengthened and connected to social protection system (case management, referral capacity development)

baseline.value: 800 social workers in statutory child protection departments; Case management procedures existing, but not followed properly

target.value: 2022:At least 10% increase of number of social workers in child protection department. A system in place for continuous training and development of social workers

title.narrative: An alternative care policy in line with the 2009 Guidelines for the Alternative Care of Children is implemented in the country

baseline.value: National DI Strategy and Action Plan available

target.value: 2022:Legal amendments in line with the planned measures in the DI Action Plan

actual.value: 2020:The Social Service Act adopted but entering into force postponed due to political reasons.
